verses.roman:
eṣa āyāti savitā
tvāṁ didṛkṣur jagat-pate
muṣṇan gabhasti-cakreṇa
nṛṇāṁ cakṣūṁṣi tigma-guḥ

synonyms: eṣaḥ—this; āyāti—comes; savitā—the sun-god; tvām—You; didṛkṣuḥ—wanting to see; jagat-pate—O Lord of the universe; muṣṇan—stealing; gabhasti—of his rays; cakreṇa—with the circle; nṛṇām—of men; cakṣūṁṣi—the eyes; tigma—intense; guḥ—whose radiation.
translation: Lord Savitā has come to see You, O Lord of the universe. He is blinding everyone's eyes with his intensely effulgent rays.
